instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
Hi guys, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, customer said it stopped working after an update. Since this is not a T2 chip version I dont think its a software issue. The machine takes no charge 5.12v, no amp on all ports. I measure as follows:

PP20V on <CAPACITOR>C3201</CAPACITOR>: 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC</SIGNAL> on <CAPACITOR>C3208</CAPACITOR>: 3.3v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> on <CAPACITOR>C3200</CAPACITOR>: 0v (no short)
PPBUS: 0.014v (no short)

Next I checked <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>
L6900: 0V (no short)
PPVIN <CAPACITOR>C6906</CAPACITOR>: 1.33 (no short)
Enable signal: 2.22v (Assume this means <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is OK?)

Next I checked <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
all resistor measure OK and looks very clean
I have tried to replace it, as a lucky shot but all values remain the same as above.

I cannot find any short on all big coils as well. Suggestions as what to check next, or if I forgot something in my work flow above?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
"PPVIN <CAPACITOR>C6906</CAPACITOR>: 1.33 (no short)"
Post diode mode reading, red probe connected to ground.
Do NOT assume that only pure short is bad!

Check R/<DIODE>D6902</DIODE>; post their voltages.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
Here you go:

Diode reading: 0.135
<RESISTOR>R6902</RESISTOR>: 0 ohm, 5.18v
<DIODE>D6902</DIODE> pin 1: 0v
pin 2: 5.18v
pin 3: 1.31v

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
Here also the other diode readings for <DIODE>D6902</DIODE>:
Pin 1: 0.455
Pin 2: 0.542

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message: I found <RESISTOR>R6907</RESISTOR> was at 22ohm, replaced it and now back to 2.2ohm, didnt fix it though:P

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
"Diode reading: 0.135"
As expected, too low value!
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR>/6.
If still low, replace <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>.
<DIODE>D6902</DIODE> MUST be replaced too; is now burnt.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message: Values seem OK after removing the 2 capacitors. Only issue is my only donor board has no <DIODE>D6902</DIODE>, will report back when I get my hands on one.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> seems to have the same spec, so I used that one and, it works:) thanks bro your a genius!

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message:
I bet only one cap was bad.
For the future, remove components one by one and check every time the result.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS
threads.message: Yes the one near the IC. Got another one today with a bad cap in the same line and easy fix using the same strategy, thanks again!
